column1: Sodium is an element that the body needs to work properly.
The most common form of sodium is sodium chloride, which is table salt.
Too much sodium in the diet may lead to: - High blood pressure in some people - A serious buildup of fluid in people with congestive heart failure, cirrhosis of the liver, or kidney disease
Sodium in the diet (called dietary sodium) is measured in milligrams (mg).
Eating habits and attitudes about food that are formed during childhood are likely to influence eating habits for life.
